p: FigureÂ 6 shows projected changes in the number of days with FFDI greater than 25, as well as with FFDI greater than its historical 95 th percentile. For each of the three different modelling methods, results are only shown for locations where at least two thirds of the ensemble members agree on the sign of the projected change. The different modelling approaches are consistent with each other in projecting a future increase in the severity of near-surface fire weather conditions as represented by the FFDI for almost all regions throughout Australia.
